<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 11"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Cassock of Devotion](/Equipment.aspx?ID=420)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Focused" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=74" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 607 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Price** 1,150 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn garment

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Each _cassock of devotion_ depicts scenes related to the domains of a certain deity. It serves as a religious symbol of that deity, and it doesn’t need to be wielded to provide that benefit. You gain a +2 item bonus to Religion checks and a +1 item bonus to the divine skill of the deity to whom the cassock is dedicated.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> envision;  **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** You gain 1 Focus Point, which you can spend only to cast a cleric domain spell for a domain belonging to the deity the cassock is dedicated to. If you don’t spend this Focus Point by the end of this turn, it is lost.

**Craft Requirements** You are a cleric who worships the deity tied to the cassock.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Cassock of Devotion
